Andy Coulson has always claimed he knew nothing about the hacking but last week he quit as David Cameron 's communications chief, saying when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on. Even with the number of suspects and alleged victims growing, many doubt the scandal will change Britain's keenly competitive tabloid culture. Newspapers believe readers are hungry for scoops-- and will forgive tabloids their transgressions
